briefTitle: Respimat® Combivent Trial in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)

armGroups.label: COMBIVENT Respimat 20/100 mcg
interventionNames: Drug: Placebo via corresponding inhaler for blinding purposes

armGroups.label: COMBIVENT CFC-MDI 36/206 mcg
interventionNames: Drug: Placebo via corresponding inhaler for blinding purposes

armGroups.label: Ipratropium Respimat 20 mcg
interventionNames: Drug: Placebo via corresponding inhaler for blinding purposes

interventions.name: Placebo via corresponding inhaler for blinding purposes

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Outpatients of either sex, 40 years or older, with a diagnosis of COPD (FEV1 65% predicted normal and FEV1/FVC 70%).

Exclusion Criteria:

Patients with significant diseases other than COPD that may either put the patient at risk because of participation in the study or a disease which may influence the results of the study or the patient's ability to participate in the study, with a history of asthma or allergic rhinitis, who regularly use daytime oxygen therapy for more than 1 hour per day and in the investigator's opinion will be unable to abstain from the use of oxygen therapy or using oral corticosteroid me dication at unstable doses (i.e., less than 6 weeks on a stable dose) or at a dose in excess of the equivalent of 10 mg of prednisone per day or 20 mg every other day will be excluded.

outcomeMeasures.title: FEV1 AUC0-6 at Day 85
outcomeMeasures.description: Area between the test-day baseline FEV1 and the FEV1 change from the test-day baseline curve from 0 to 6 hours divided by 6 at Day 85

outcomeMeasures.title: FEV1 AUC0-4 at Day 85
outcomeMeasures.description: Area between the test-day baseline FEV1 and the FEV1 change from the test-day baseline curve from 0 to 4 hours divided by 4 at Day 85

outcomeMeasures.title: FEV1 AUC4-6 at Day 85
outcomeMeasures.description: Area between the test-day baseline FEV1 and the FEV1 change from the test-day baseline curve from 4 to 6 hours divided by 2 at Day 85

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Onset of Therapeutic FEV1 Response at Day 1
outcomeMeasures.description: Achievement of recorded FEV1 measurement of at least 1.15 times of the corresponding test-day baseline value at any time during the first 2 hours of observation after drug administration at Day 1

outcomeMeasures.description: Achievement of recorded FEV1 measurement of at least 1.15 times of the corresponding test-day baseline value at any time during the first 2 hours of observation after drug administration at Day 29

outcomeMeasures.title: Duration of Therapeutic FEV1 Response at Day 1
outcomeMeasures.description: The time interval between the onset and the the termination of a therapeutic FEV1 response (at least 1.15 times the corresponding test-day baseline value) during the 6-hour observation period at Day 1

outcomeMeasures.title: Rescue Medication Use on Pulmonary Test Day 1
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients used rescue medication during the 6-hour pulmonary function testing after drug administration on Day 1

outcomeMeasures.title: Rescue Medication Use on Pulmonary Test Day 29
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients used rescue medication during the 6-hour pulmonary function testing after drug administration on Day 29

outcomeMeasures.title: Rescue Medication Use on Pulmonary Test Day 57
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients used rescue medication during the 6-hour pulmonary function testing after drug administration on Day 57

outcomeMeasures.title: Rescue Medication Use on Pulmonary Test Day 85
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients used rescue medication during the 6-hour pulmonary function testing after drug administration on Day 85

outcomeMeasures.title: Night-time Rescue Medication Use
outcomeMeasures.description: The mean number of puffs of rescue medication used during the night-time per week during the entire study (including baseline and on-treatment period)

outcomeMeasures.title: Daytime Rescue Medication Use
outcomeMeasures.description: The mean number of puffs of rescue medication used during the daytime per week during the entire study (including baseline and on-treatment period)

outcomeMeasures.title: Night-time Symptom Score
outcomeMeasures.description:
The weekly mean night-time symptom score per week during the entire study (including baseline and on-treatment period).

Night-time COPD symptoms: 0=none 1=some - slept well 2=woke once 3=woke several times 4=woke most of night

outcomeMeasures.title: Daytime Symptom Score
outcomeMeasures.description:
The weekly mean daytime symptom score per week during the entire study (including baseline and on-treatment period).

Daytime COPD symptoms: 0=none 1=occasional 2=frequent, no interference with activities 3=most of day, interference with activities 4=prevent working and activities

outcomeMeasures.title: Trough Peak Expiratory Flow Rate (PEFR)
outcomeMeasures.description: The weekly mean trough PEFR during the entire study (including baseline and on-treatment period)

outcomeMeasures.title: Physician's Global Evaluation Score on Pulmonary Function Testing Day 29
outcomeMeasures.description:
Physician's Global Evaluation score is based on the need for concomitant medication, number and severity of exacerbations since the last visit, severity of cough, ability to exercise, amount of wheezing, etc.

Score: 1,2 = poor; 3,4 = fair; 5,6 =good; 7,8 = excellent.

outcomeMeasures.title: Physician's Global Evaluation Score on Pulmonary Function Testing Day 57
outcomeMeasures.description:
Physician's Global Evaluation score is based on the need for concomitant medication, number and severity of exacerbations since the last visit, severity of cough, ability to exercise, amount of wheezing, etc.

Score: 1,2 = poor; 3,4 = fair; 5,6 =good; 7,8 = excellent.

outcomeMeasures.title: Physician's Global Evaluation Score on Pulmonary Function Testing Day 85
outcomeMeasures.description:
Physician's Global Evaluation score is based on the need for concomitant medication, number and severity of exacerbations since the last visit, severity of cough, ability to exercise, amount of wheezing, etc.

Score: 1,2 = poor; 3,4 = fair; 5,6 =good; 7,8 = excellent.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation During the On-treatment Period
outcomeMeasures.description: COPD exacerbation is defined as an increase or new onset of more than one of the following respiratory symptoms (cough, sputum, sputum purulence, wheezing, dyspnea, and chest tightness) having a duration of three or more days requiring treatment with an antibiotic and/or systemic steroids with or without hospital admission.

outcomeMeasures.title: COPD Exacerbation Rate During the On-treatment Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of patients experiencing a COPD exacerbation per patient year. COPD exacerbation is defined as an increase or new onset of more than one of the following respiratory symptoms (cough, sputum, sputum purulence, wheezing, dyspnea, and chest tightness) having a duration of three or more days requiring treatment with an antibiotic and/or systemic steroids with or without hospital admission.

outcomeMeasures.title: COPD Exacerbation During the On-treatment Period
outcomeMeasures.description: COPD exacerbation is defined as an increase or new onset of more than one of the following respiratory symptoms (cough, sputum, sputum purulence, wheezing, dyspnea, and chest tightness) having a duration of three or more days requiring treatment with an antibiotic and/or systemic steroids with or without hospital admission.

outcomeMeasures.title: Frequency Distribution of Satisfaction Rating With Inhaler Attributes
Mean Rating Scores of Satisfaction With Inhaler - Overall Feeling of Inhaling Medicine
outcomeMeasures.description:
Patients rated their response on a seven point Likert scale:

1 = very dissatisfied, 2 = dissatisfied, 3 = somewhat dissatisfied, 4 = neither satisfied nor dissatisfied, 5 = somewhat satisfied, 6 = satisfied, 7 = very satisfied.

outcomeMeasures.description:

outcomeMeasures.title: Device Preference (Respimat or MDI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Frequency of patients due to device preference

outcomeMeasures.title: Rating of Action of Turning Clear Base of Respimat
outcomeMeasures.description: Frequency of patients due to rating of action of turning clear base of Respimat

outcomeMeasures.title: Noncompartmental Pharmacokinetic Parameters of Ipratropium at Steady State
outcomeMeasures.description: Geometric mean area under the plasma drug concentration time curve over one dosing interval (AUCτ). Each patient had eight plasma samples (trough pre-dose, 5, 15, 30, and 60 minutes post-dose, as well as 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose).

outcomeMeasures.title: Noncompartmental Parameters of Albuterol at Steady State
outcomeMeasures.description: Geometric mean area under the plasma drug concentration time curve over one dosing interval (AUCτ). Each patient had eight plasma samples (trough pre-dose, 5, 15, 30, and 60 minutes post-dose, as well as 2, 4, and 6 hours post-dose).
